Scotch Tape Splice Kit, 5717, 15 kV

  • It is suitable for use on 5 to 15 kV tape shield, wire shield or UniShield® cables with aluminum or copper conductors
  • This kit includes two rolls of Scotch® Semi-Conducting Tape 13, 10 rolls of Scotch® 130C, one coil of 3M™ Scotch® Grounding Braid 25, three rolls of Scotch® Shielding Braid and more.

entry.title: 3M 8421-1X72 - 8421 White 1 x 72 Yd Bulk 8421-1x72 7000029115
entry.summary:
Vendor: 3M
Type:
Price: 41.37

[shortdesc]

8421 WHITE 1 X 72 YD BULK

  • Designed for splicing of photographic film processing, 3M™ Photo Film Splicing Tape 8421 is a creamy white splicing tape featuring a thin, yet strong, polyester backing
  • It features an aggressive, versatile rubber adhesive that is both solvent and chemical resistant.
    • [/shortdesc]

    Product Information

    Brand 3M
    Origin Country Mexico

    Product Information

  • Used for splicing of most photographic film and web processing
  • Aggressive rubber adhesive grabs quickly and adheres well to a variety of films
  • Excellent solvent and chemical resistance, especially those found in photographic processes
  • Remains flexible at -60°F (-50°C) and is dimensionally stable up to 300°F (150°C)
  • White backing is used to easily identify splices
  • Industry specific tape for when electrical tape isn't effective
    		•

entry.title: 3M Scotch 130C-1X15 - Linerless Rubber Splicing Tape 130C Black 30 mil (0.76mm) 1 Inch x 15 ft (25 mm x 4.6 m) 7000140715
entry.summary:
Vendor: 3M
Type: Splicing Tapes
Price: 39.19

[shortdesc]

Scotch Linerless Rubber Splicing Tape, 130C, black, 30 mil (0.76 mm), 1 in x 15 ft (25 mm x 4.6 m)

  • Scotch® Linerless Rubber Splicing Tape 130C is a highly conformable, linerless, ethylene rubber, high-voltage insulating tape, formulated to provide excellent thermal dissipation of splice heat
  • The tape is designed for use in splicing and terminating wires and cables, and has a continuous operating temperate rated up to 90˚C (194°F)
  • This product can be used for low and high-voltage applications up to 69kV, and has excellent physical and electrical properties which provide immediate moisture seals.
    • [/shortdesc]

    Product Information

    Brand 3M
    Line Scotch
    Application Insulation
    Backing Material Ethlylene Propylene Rubber
    Color Black
    Elongation 850 Percent
    Length 15 ft
    Width 1 Inch
    Max Operating Temp (Celsius) 90
    Max Operating Temp (Fahrenheit) 194
    Origin Country United States
    Product Type Splicing Tapes
    Tensile Strength 250 psi

    Product Information

  • Linerless, self-bonding, primary insulating tape rated through 69 kV
  • Designed for overload temperatures up to 130°C (266°F)
  • High thermal conductivity
  • Weather resistant
  • Compatible with common, solid dielectric cable insulation
  • Stable over wide application temperature range
  • Bus bar insulation to 35 kV

    • Suggested Application

  • Primary insulation for splicing all types of solid dielectric insulated cables through 69 kV and building stress cones up to 35 kV
  • Ideal for sealing collars, closure sealing, drop wire splice insulating, sheath build-up or constructing auxiliary sleeves
  • M
    		•

Scotch Commercial Grade Linerless Rubber Splicing Tape, 2242, 3/4 in x 15 ft, 30 mil

  • Scotch® Commercial Grade Linerless Rubber Splicing Tape 2242 is a linerless, self–bonding, insulating tape with an ethylene propylene base

    Product Information

entry.title: 3M Scotch 23-3/4X30 - Rubber Splicing Tape 23 in Black with Liner (30 mil x 3/4 Inch x 30 ft) 7000007286
entry.summary:
Vendor: 3M
Type: Splicing Tapes
Price: 18.75

[shortdesc]

Scotch Rubber Splicing Tape, 23, black, with liner, 30 mil (0.76 mm), 3/4 in x 30 ft (19 mm x 9.1 m)

  • Scotch® Rubber Splicing Tape 23 is a conformable, self-fusing, ethylene propylene rubber voltage tape
  • The high-insulating tape has a “snakeskin” liner that is easily removed as the tape is applied, an operating temperature up to 90°C (194°F), and can be used for splices up to 69kV.
    • [/shortdesc][additional] DOWNLOAD SPEC SHEET [/additional]

    Product Information

    Brand 3M
    Line Scotch
    Application Electrical Maintenance
    Backing Material Ethlylene Propylene Rubber
    Color Black
    Elongation 10 Percent
    Length 30 ft
    Width 3/4 Inch
    Max Operating Temp (Celsius) 90
    Max Operating Temp (Fahrenheit) 194
    Operating Temp (Celsius) Up to 90
    Operating Temp (Fahrenheit) Up to 194
    Origin Country Brazil
    Product Type Splicing Tapes
    Tensile Strength 8 Pound-Force Per Square Inch
    Thickness 30 mil, 0.76mm

    Product Information

  • Compatible with all solid dielectric cable insulations
  • Can splice and terminate cables with emergency overload temperatures of up to 130°C (266°F)
  • Durable and self-fusing
  • Stretches up to 100% to provide void-free, moisture resistant insulation
  • A special polyester liner which will not stick to the tape upon unwind

    • Suggested Application

  • Primary electrical insulation for splicing cable from 600 volts through 69 kV on all solid dielectric cables
  • Primary insulation for building stress cones on cables up to 35 kV on all solid dielectric cables
  • Moisture sealing electrical connections and end

entry.title: 3M 8403-1X72 - Polyester Tape 8403 Green 1 Inch x 72 Yards 7000048534
entry.summary:
Vendor: 3M
Type: Splicing Tapes
Price: 51.63

[shortdesc]

3M(TM) Polyester Tape 8403 Green, 1 in x 72 yd, 36 per case

  • For anodizing, composite bonding, and splicing, use 3M™ Polyester Tape 8403
  • This translucent-green tinted tape is coated with a silicone adhesive that bonds well on difficult surfaces, including silicone coated papers and films
  • It is chemical resistant and performs under a wide range of temperatures and environments
  • This tape is a thicker version of 3M™ Polyester Tape 8402.
    • [/shortdesc][additional] DOWNLOAD SPEC SHEET [/additional]

    Product Information

    Brand 3M
    Length 72yds
    Width 1 Inch
    Origin Country United States
    Product Type Splicing Tapes

    Product Information

  • Works in demanding conditions and retains flexibility in autoclave conditions in temperatures ranging from -6°F (-5°C) to 35°F (177°C)
  • Silicone adhesive provides clean removal from a variety of surfaces
  • Chemical resistant adhesive and backing provide durability in difficult environments such as anodization
  • Retains flexibility in autoclave conditions in temperatures ranging from -60°F (-50°C) to 350°F (176°C)
  • Ideal for splicing applications on surfaces that are difficult to adhere too, such as silicone coated papers and films
  • Translucent green backing is easily identifiable for splicing applications
  • Waterproof and easily removable
